comments.text: Any other PC troubleshooting questions I can help with?
comments.author: @ZachsTechTurf

comments.text: Thats probably bcuz of the 2mb ram
comments.author: @AsianKevu

comments.text: And make sure your hdmi isnt plugged into your motherboard
comments.author: @RXGE-Edits

comments.text: and don’t forget to check if your PC has cpu cooler
comments.author: @AbandonedKinte

comments.text: I'd bet everything, that he pluged the hdmi into the motherboard.
comments.author: @Kcteb

comments.text: 7500f, 9060xt user here. I fixed this exact issue by turning off hyper-fx or something like that on my gpu software
comments.author: @mr.mloteczek2215

comments.text: Because Fortnite is a online game I would also check the ping and Overall Internet stability
comments.author: @Xavrite

comments.text: This happens all the time. You need to disable the "family gaming controller" thingy in network adapters/control panel. I had these stutters since I got my new PC, and after disabling that, fortnite pretty much never stutters.
comments.author: @nekoslayer973

comments.text: Hombre plugged his DisplayPort into the motherboard 😆
comments.author: @scottstorchfan

comments.text:
I would also suggest benchmarking other games besides Fortnite 

This is probably the fastest way to determine if it's actually the hardware or the game (idk how it could be the game but I'd still try it out)
comments.author: @adityaanuragi6916

comments.text: Something made me wonder if they applied thermal paste.
comments.author: @OnSilverWings

comments.text: What if it's because of the Wi-Fi?
comments.author: @DeathGamers770

comments.text: Just built my PC back up after having to replace motherboard thanks to your videos, and several other creators. Thank you!
comments.author: @AlwaysWright42

comments.text: Probably running 8gb system ram or have their monitor plugged into their motherboard
comments.author: @WayneWatson1

comments.text: Hi, great video!
comments.author: @Fireboy-n4k

comments.text: Don't forget to plug your monitor into the GPU and not the Motherboard, especially since many Ryzen CPUs nowadays come with a IGPU
comments.author: @JoJos_RetroGaminG36

comments.text: Or maybe their system is just set to use the integrated graphics, not the dedicated one.
comments.author: @smabedi

comments.text: Also make sure you aren’t bogging down adrenaline. A common example is having game supported fsr and then adrenaline fluid motion frames at the same time and this causes terrible gameplay behavior. For me this occurred on where winds meet and it was a stuttering mess
comments.author: @chaosifuzii0n157

comments.text: Make sure to plug your hdmi/display port into the gpu and not the motherboard
comments.author: @LavZy04

comments.text: My laptop with a 9300h and a 1650 cant run it either, but that makes more sense
comments.author: @mosfet-guy

comments.text: hi zach how are you doing . so i have a 14400f on a H610M K but i have a heating problem with the vrm mos as when i allow my cpu to use 100w it rocks 105C in less than 5 min , do you recommend me making a sandwich heatsink alone or should i add a mini 50mm fan too??
comments.author: @Maen_Alsaleh

comments.text:
same problem i had with 7500f 9060xt in valorant, i had lot of microstutters, i followed a windows optimisation guide, specifically 10min one from lecctron, and now its buttery smooth again.
so do what this vid says+ the optimization guide, and it should be good
comments.author: @Someone-md9vd

comments.text: Hey dude,I’ve been watching your videos for a while now and I wanted to ask a question,I’ve been into gaming for a while now,but all I’ve had to play with is my brothers old Xbox 360 and my Nintendo ds ,and the only time I’ve been getting specs of modern gaming is when I visit my friends house or when my older siblings come over,and I’ve been wanting to get my own consoles,but my parents always tell me no because gaming is useless and expensive,I’ve been hoping that you could either give me good job ideas to make my own money where I don’t need to be over 18,or you could name some stores that give modern and last generation consoles for good deals,for example,the Xbox one,ps4,maybe the Nintendo switch ,or modern consoles like the Xbox series s,ps5,and Nintendo switch 2,or if they have any budget gaming pcs under 600$
comments.author: @Sirvexvex99

comments.text: I have the same cpu and gpu and had the same problem apparently it had to do with a fortnite update so i had to switch from direct x12 tot performance and wait until they fixed it or there is a driver update
comments.author: @JoostKeustermans

comments.text: It may also be the cause of slow or not enough ram(I doubt tho but amd cpus benefit from faster ram speeds) and the psu if it's not enough wattage and basically everything else he mentioned, or it can the mobos bios, tbh it could be anything
comments.author: @CcGoku_solos_your_fav_verse
